concept.title: Contacting technical support
concept.shortdesc: If you encounter a problem that you cannot resolve by consulting the documentation, your company's designated support contact can log a call with technical support. To ensure that your problem is resolved efficiently and successfully, you collect information before you log your call.

conbody.p: If you are not a designated support contact at your company, contact your administrator for information.

section.title: Information to gather
section.p: Before you contact technical support, gather the following information:

li.p: A brief description of the nature of your issue.
Detailed error messages that you see when the issue occurs.
Detailed steps to reproduce the issue.
Related log files, session files, configuration files, and data files.
Information about your product and system environment, which you can obtain as described in "System information."

section.title: System information
section.p: When you call technical support, you might be asked to provide information about your environment.
If your problem does not prevent you from logging in, much of this information is available on the About page, which provides information about your applications.

You can access the About page by selecting Help > About. If the About page is not accessible, you can obtain the version number of any application by viewing the version.txt file that is located under the installation directory for each application. If the About page is not accessible, you can use the command nettracker admin -buildinfo to obtain version information.

section.title: Contact information for technical support
section.p: For ways to contact technical support, see the Product Technical Support website: (http://www.ibm.com/support/entry/portal/open_service_request).
section.note: To enter a support request, you must log in with an account. If possible, this account must be linked to your customer number. To learn more about associating your account with your customer number, see Support Resources > Entitled Software Support on the Support Portal.
